column4: Hi all. I have a bash script which I want it start at the ubuntu(feisty) boot time, how to do that?
I have tried to add the script at '/etc/rc.local', but seems not work
I tried that, add the script(e.g. vlanstart.sh) in /etc/rc.local, but seems not work
How to check if the rc.local is executed at the boot time?
it gets called by /etc/init.d/rc.local. check if /etc/rc2.d has a symlink back to that rc.local file
I don't know if the rc.local run at the boot time, how to verify?
put a "touch /home/fog_proxy/filename. if that filename is created, rc.local is run
I add the touch command at rc.local, but not work. I think rc.local did not executed, but I don't know why
I have tried. init.d/rc.local is working, but /etc/rc.local not
